verses.roman:
kāhāṅ cāṅgera upara sei maraṇa-pramāda!
kāhāṅ 'neta-dhaṭī' punaḥ,--e-saba prasāda!

synonyms: kāhāṅ—on one hand; cāṅgera upara—on the cāṅga; sei—that; maraṇa-pramāda—danger of death; kāhāṅ—on the other hand; neta-dhaṭī—the silken cloth; punaḥ—again; e-saba—all this; prasāda—mercy.
translation: "I was lifted upon the cāṅga to be killed, but on the contrary I was honored with this silken cloth. This is all Your mercy.
